cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin moving NNW overnight)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest to the South Carolina coast on Sunday, then drift slowly northeast along the central and northern South Carolina coast and into southern North Carolina early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: A Tropical Storm Warning is posted from Savannah River to Little River Inlet SC (no watches north of Little River Inlet).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina coast and southern North Carolina coast (including Cape Fear to Surf City)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) are possible late Monday through Tuesday with a 28 % cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground level possible, mainly south of Cape Fear.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain expected across southeastern North Carolina, locally higher in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along area beaches and an isolated tornado risk.
